programme.title: Marc Márquez: More than a Comeback
programme.desc: After 2,184 days, 108 crashes, six surgeries and 30 missed Grands Prix, Marc Marquez has once again claimed the MotoGP World Championship title, doing so for an astonishing seventh time. But it’s been more than a comeback for the Spanish rider, who has endured his own personal calvary over the past six years. Through exclusive interviews with Marc, his friends and family, and never-before-seen footage, this 30-minute documentary provides previously unheard perspectives on the highs and lows of the Spaniard’s arduous journey back to the top of Grand Prix motorcycle racing

programme.title: Aix vs Limoges - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germain's 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

The teams are competing for a place in the final that will be played at the Ullevaal Stadion in Oslo, Norway on May 2026. Barcelona are the current Champions.

programme.title: Football Legends - News
programme.desc: In the world of sports, few debates ignite passion and enthusiasm quite like the discussion surrounding the greatest football players of all time. This topic transcends generations, cultures, and nationalities, as fans passionately defend their favorites and recount unforgettable moments on the pitch. From legendary goal scorers to masterful playmakers, the players who have left an indelible mark on the game deserve recognition and celebration. " Football Legends" explore the remarkable careers and contributions of these iconic players who have shaped the beautiful game.

programme.title: ONE Fight Night 37 - 2025
programme.desc: Kryklia vs Agdeve hits Bangkok's Lumpinee Stadium, live in U.S. primetime Fri, Nov 7. The towering Ukrainian Roman Kryklia chases a historic third strap as he meets unbeaten 21-year-old KO artist Samet "The King" Agdeve for the inaugural ONE Heavyweight Kickboxing World Title. Also: Nico "King of the North" Carrillo vs Luke "The Chef" Lessei in featherweight Muay Thai, plus Elbek Alyshov, Carlo "The Bull" Bumina-ang, Jacob Smith, Rambolek and Abdulla Dayakaev.

programme.title: Marc Márquez: More than a Comeback
programme.desc: After 2,184 days, 108 crashes, six surgeries and 30 missed Grands Prix, Marc Marquez has once again claimed the MotoGP World Championship title, doing so for an astonishing seventh time. But it’s been more than a comeback for the Spanish rider, who has endured his own personal calvary over the past six years. Through exclusive interviews with Marc, his friends and family, and never-before-seen footage, this 30-minute documentary provides previously unheard perspectives on the highs and lows of the Spaniard’s arduous journey back to the top of Grand Prix motorcycle racing

programme.title: Aix vs Limoges - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germain's 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Al Sadd vs Al Arabi - Qatar Stars League 2025/26 - W8
programme.desc: The Qatari League is the official football league in Qatar. The league includes 12 teams. programme.title: Nine O'Clock bulletin - NEWS
programme.desc: Latest news from the beIn SPORTS News room, previewing and reviewing developments and scores with contribution from around the world from beIN's reporters.

programme.title: FIFA U-17 World Cup Qatar 2025 Bulletin - @22:00
programme.desc: A special bulletin covering all the news about the FIFA U-17 World Cup Qatar 2025, which will see the participation of 48 teams, including six Arab teams: Qatar, Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, Morocco, Tunisia and Egypt. The FIFA U-17 World Cup Qatar 2025 is the first of five consecutive editions that Qatar will be hosting.

programme.title: Special Interview - 14/11/25
programme.desc: A daily Special Interview related to an important issue of the day. The interview offers the background and insight into the issue chosen from the world of sport.

programme.title: Special Report - 14/11/25
programme.desc: "Special Report" is a single long feature from one of beIN SPORTS News reporters that takes an alternative look at a subject from the world of sport.

programme.title: Al Jawla - Live Studio @23:00
programme.desc: Al Jawla covers the latest news and stories from sporting events across the planet. Including latest results and latest scores from the most recent games taking place. This daily look at the latest stories provides a fast paced update to sporting events.

programme.title: Stats - 14/11/25
programme.desc: An in depth look at the statistics that have emerged from the latest sporting events. All the data and facts for an even deeper understanding of the sporting world

programme.title: Football Legends - News
programme.desc: In the world of sports, few debates ignite passion and enthusiasm quite like the discussion surrounding the greatest football players of all time. This topic transcends generations, cultures, and nationalities, as fans passionately defend their favorites and recount unforgettable moments on the pitch. From legendary goal scorers to masterful playmakers, the players who have left an indelible mark on the game deserve recognition and celebration. " Football Legends" explore the remarkable careers and contributions of these iconic players who have shaped the beautiful game.
